item.title: July 2019
item.description: new image available: Fedora 30 public as image: Standard_Fedora_30_latest supported otc flavors: https://imagefactory.otc.t-systems.com/flavor-list default user: linux

item.title: June 2019
item.description: Microsoft Windows Server Patches of 2019 June (12th) Windows Server 2008 R2 * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - June 2019 (KB890830) * 2019-06 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4503292) Windows Server 2012 R2 * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - June 2019 (KB890830) * 2019-06 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4503259) * 2019-06 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4503290) * 2019-06 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4503276)

item.title: May 2019
item.description: Microsoft Windows Server Patches of 2019 May (15th) Windows Server 2008 R2 * 2019-05 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4499164) * 2019-05 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4499175) * 2019-05 Security and Quality Rollup for .NET Framework 3.5.1, 4.5.2, 4.6, 4.6.1, 4.6.2, 4.7, 4.7.1, 4.7.2, 4.8 for Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2 for x64 (KB4499406) * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - May 2019 (KB890830) * 2019-05 Security Only Update for .

item.title: April 2019
item.description: Microsoft Windows Server Patches of 2019 April (10th) Windows Server 2008 R2 * 2019-04 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4493472) * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - April 2019 (KB890830) Windows Server 2012 R2 * 2019-04 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4493467) * 2019-04 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4493446) * 2019-04 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4493435) * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - April 2019 (KB890830)

item.title: March 2019
item.description: new Images: * Enterprise_Windows_STD_2019_CORE_KVM * Enterprise_Windows_STD_2019_BMS Microsoft Windows Server Patches of 2019 March (13th) Windows Server 2008 R2 * 2019-03 Servicing Stack Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4490628) * 2019-03 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4489885) * 2019-03 Security Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4474419) * 2019-03 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4489878) * 2019-03 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4489873) * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - March 2019 (KB890830)

item.description: new Images: * Enterprise_Windows_STD_2019_KVM Microsoft Windows Server Patches of 2019 February (13th) Windows Server 2008 R2 * Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - February 2019 (KB890830) * 2019-02 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4486563) * 2019-02 Security Only Update for .NET Framework 3.5.1, 4.5.2, 4.6, 4.6.1, 4.6.2, 4.7, 4.7.1, 4.7.2 for Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2 for x64 (KB4487121)

item.title: January 2019
item.description: new image availabe: Standard_Fedora_29_latest MS Patches of 2019 Januar (09th) Windows Server 2008 R2 2019-01 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4480960) 2019-01 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4480965) 2019-01 Security and Quality Rollup for .NET Framework 3.5.1, 4.5.2, 4.6, 4.6.1, 4.6.2, 4.7, 4.7.1, 4.7.2 for Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2 for x64 (KB4481480) 2019-01 Security Only Update for .

item.title: December 2018
item.description: CentOS 7.6 available as Standard_CentOS_7_latest now RHEL 7.6 available as Enterprise_RedHat_7_latest now Oracle Linux 7.6 available as Enterprise_OracleLinux_7_latest now Ubuntu 16.04 * preconfigure network interfaces for enp4s network cards used in KVM flavors like m3. MS Patches of 2018 December (11th) Windows Server 2008 R2 Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4468323) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - December 2018 (KB890830) 2018-12 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4471318) 2018-12 Security and Quality Rollup for .

item.title: November 2018
item.description: Debian 9 each created vm creates its own unique /etc/machine-id at first boot Debian 9.6 released (Standard_Debian_9_latest) more information for release changes: https://www.debian.org/News/2018/20181110 MS Patches of 2018 November (14th) Windows Server 2008 R2 2018-11 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4467106) 2018-11 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4466536) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - November 2018 (KB890830) 2018-11 Security and Quality Rollup for .

item.title: October 2018
item.description: Updated Linux images provided on 2018-31-10: Ubuntu-18.04: Fix wrong repository configuration using Ubuntu 18.04 with BMS flavor MS Patches of 2018 October Windows Server 2008 R2 2018-10 Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB3177467) 2018-10 Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based systems (KB4462949) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - October 2018 (KB890830) 2018-10 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4462923) 2018-10 Security and Quality Rollup for .

item.title: September 2018
item.description: September 2018: Updated Linux images provided on 2018-09-20 – 25. Changes: CentOS Images: new support for V100 flavors with NVIDEA GPGPU and Cuda support flavors: p2.2xlarge.8 p2.4xlarge.8 p2.8xlarge.8 physical.p2.large Updated Linux images provided on 2018-09-20 – 25. Changes: SUSE Images: Official public image for SLES15 (SP0) and openSUSE15, both using python3 only for preinstalled tools. Migrate OBS repositories from home:garloff:OTC to Cloud:OTC:xxx (openSUSE15, openSUSE42, SLES15, SLES12SP3).

item.title: August 2018
item.description: August 2018: Updated Linux images provided on 2018-08-28 – 30. Changes: Pending EulerOS fixes released for L1TF/Foreshadow-NG. All SUSE images, CentOS7, EulerOS2: Ensure we have a unique machine-id. Include kata containers for secure containerization in CCE_EulerOS_2 and openSUSE_42_Docker. Updated Linux images provided on 2018-08-17 – 22. Changes: All images (except EulerOS): Fixes for CVE-2018-3620, CVE-2018-3646 (L1TF/Foreshadow-NG). Also includes fixes for CVE-2018-5390 and -5391 where not provided before. Updated Linux images provided on 2018-08-10.

item.title: July 2018
item.description: Updated Windows images provided on 2018-07-20. Changes: MS Patches of 2018 July Windows Server 2008 R2 Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 x64 Edition (KB4130978) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - July 2018 (KB890830) 2018-07 Security Only Update for .NET Framework 3.5.1, 4.5.2, 4.6, 4.6.1, 4.6.2, 4.7, 4.7.1, 4.7.2 for Windows 7 and Server 2008 R2 for x64 (KB4340004) 2018-07 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4338823) 2018-07 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4338818) 2018-07 Security and Quality Rollup for .

item.title: June 2018
item.description: Updated Linux images provided on 2018-06-05. Changes: CentOS-7 Security fix for Spectre Variant-4 (CVE-2018-3639) new version Debian 4.9.65-3+deb9u2 see: https://imagefactory.otc.t-systems.com/Blog-Review/SpecExLeak/Spectre_3a_4.html Updated Linux images provided on 2018-06-01. Changes: New Ubuntu images released Standard_Ubuntu_14.04_latest Standard_Ubuntu_16.04_latest Replaces Community Ubuntu images, which are no longer supported. Community_Ubuntu_14.04_TSI_latest replaced by: Standard_Ubuntu_14.04_latest Community_Ubuntu_16.04_TSI_latest replaced by: Standard_Ubuntu_16.04_latest More information about timeline and technical changes: https://imagefactory.otc.t-systems.com/Blog-Review/UbuntuAnnounce.html

item.title: May 2018
item.description: Updated Linux images provided on 2018-05-16. Changes: All SUSE images and EulerOS-2: Updated the injected OTC Build Service Key as it has been extended in validity.

item.title: April 2018
item.description: Updated images provided on 2018-04-13. Major changes over previous versions: Linux All: Include all updates from the Linxu distributors SLES 11 and SLES 12: Updated bms-network-setup to handle scenarios, where network devices are ordered differently than assumed in network_config.json but can not be renamed (due to conflicting names). This fixes SLES12 on physical.h2.large. SAP images: Switch clocksource to tsc on xen flavors. Add serial login for SLES11 BMS.

item.title: March 2018
item.description: Updated images provided on 2018-03-15. Major changes over previous versions: Linux - New image Standard_Fedora_27_latest Debian-9 add packages kbd and console-data (to enable ‘sudo loadkeys [de,us]‘) Redhat and Oracle images with retpoline kernel Oracle7 BMS image available Ubuntu 16 includes CVE-2017-16995 Windows Self-Managed - Release 2018-03-14-0 - added March 2018 MS Patches Windows Server 2008 R2 Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 x64 Edition (KB4074837) 2018-03 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4088875) Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4089187) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - March 2018 (KB890830) Windows Server 2012 R2 Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - March 2018 (KB890830) 2018-03 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4088876) 2018-03 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2012 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4088879) Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer 11 for Windows Server 2012 R2 (KB4089187) Windows Server 2016

item.title: February 2018
item.description: All Linux images received significant work on the bootup speed: The platform got a better performing Metadata Service (MDS) The network start scripts were tuned (wait times, waiting for mds, …) cloud-init > 0.7.6 received a patch removing unnecessary retries on 404 The generation of an optimized initrd on the kiwi built images was pushed into the background Updated SUSE images provided on 2018-02-15. Major changes over previous versions:

item.title: January 2018
item.description: Security Alert Meltdown and Spectre: https://imagefactory.otc.t-systems.com/Blog-Review/SpecExLeak/ Updated images provided on 2018-01-26. Major changes over previous versions: Ubuntu-14, Ubuntu-16 Security fix for Spectre Variant-1 (CVE-2017-5753) new version Ubuntu-14 with kernel 3.13.0-141-generic #190 new version Ubuntu-16 with kernel 4.4.0-112-generic #135 Updated Windows images provided on 2018-01-12. Major changes over previous versions: OTC Windows Self-Managed - Release 2018-01-11-0 registry keys to enable the mitigations on the server against speculative execution side-channel vulnerabilities are set: >HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Memory Management, FeatureSettingsOverride, 0 >HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Memory Management, FeatureSettingsOverrideMask, 3 >`HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE \SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Virtualization MinVmVersionForCpuBasedMitigations, 1.

item.title: December 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-12-15. Major changes over previous versions: Linux images All upstream updates, as usual Use bms-network-setup.py for creating ifcfg-* from network_data.json on Bare Metal. Make local_port_range an even number Boot time optimizations (especially SUSE12/42) Avoid cloud-init-wait-mds stalling on DNS requests CentOS-7 kmod-20-15.el7_4.6 is broken (does break override statements), resulting in Inifiniband drivers no longer loading. Fix by downgrading to el7_4.4 until RH fixes this.

item.title: November 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-11-20-21. Major changes over previous versions: RHEL/CentOS/OEL 6+7: Switch to SHA512 passwd hashing: all new user passwords are now generated with SHA512 and no more with MD5 algorithm. RHEL/CentOS/OEL 6 and EulerOS: add bash skeletons to root’s home SAPHANA images: Add recommended network tuning for HANA CentOS_7: new cloud-init version 0.7.9 Updated images provided on 2017-11-15. Major changes over previous versions:

item.title: October 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-10-26. Major changes over previous versions: Fedora26 new Standard_Fedora_26_latest (replaced broken Standard_Fedora_26_20171018_0 with Standard_Fedora_26_20171021_0) Updated images provided on 2017-10-23. Major changes over previous versions: RHEL7: sshd_config: add curve25519-sha256@libssh.org as KexAlgorithm RHEL6: new release version 6.9 available as RHEL_6_latest image rename image and skip the minor version number Updated images provided on 2017-10-18. Major changes over previous versions:

item.title: September 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-09-25. Major changes over previous versions: New images: openSuSE-42.3 Docker flavor, RHEL/CentOS/OEL 7.4 Add kmod-ixgbevf216 for CentOS-6 and OEL-6 Include nfs-utils for RHEL6/7 family add processor.max_cstate=1 as req by Huawei heatclient-1.5.2 tune cloud-init for lower timeouts but more retries Fix: Only start maxout-balloon on XEN

item.title: July 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-05-17. Major changes over previous versions: New images: Debian 9 (stretch) Microsoft Patches Windows Server 2008 R2 Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4020322) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool x64 - July 2017 (KB890830) 2017-07 Security Only Quality Update for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4025337) 2017-07 Security Monthly Quality Rollup for Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems (KB4025341) Windows Server 2012 R2 Update for Windows Server 2012 R2 (KB4020322) Windows Malicious Software Removal Tool for Windows 8, 8.

item.title: May 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-05-19. Major changes over previous versions: Supports nova serial console log on all images (was only enabled on some; nova console-log is supported on KVM based h2 flavors in OTC) Update from libs3-2 to libs3-4, supporting multipart up/download. Root disk mounted by label (thus working across hypervisors and bare metal) Console login hint changed to “Initial console login” to avoid confusion openSUSE42 + SLES12: new OpenStack newton python client tools Latest maintenance and security updates from all distros, as always …

item.title: April 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-04-06. Major changes over previous versions: Ubuntu images, vms starts now with preconfigured otc internal repositories. No internet access required for updating ubuntu vms.

item.title: February 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-02-27. Major changes over previous versions: all new linux images from now on are configured to use cloud-init vendor-data (except for ubuntu) vendor-data configures all images from ImageFactory with package repositories private images which are not based on an original ImageFactory image are not affected Removed all internal package repositories from the images. Images contain only repofiles with disabled public package repositories New versions: Windows 2016, Debian 8.

item.title: March 2017
item.description: Updated images provided on 2017-03-01. Major changes over previous versions: Debian 8.7 fix issues with cloud-init and generated random password for console login

item.title: December 2016
item.description: Updated images provided on 2016-12-21. Major changes over previous versions: Normal images are now built with 4GiB root filesystem. They would still easily fit into 2GiB, but as they are registered with 4GiB min_disk size, they would be resized by cloud-init (growpart, resizefs), which we can now safe for the defaults. Images now have a default RANDOM password for the default (linux) user. It is displayed as login hint for noVNC emergency login, but not visible to unprivileged users.

item.title: November 2016
item.description: Updated images provided on 2016-11-17. The major changes to the previous versions are: Images include the latest updates from cw46 Add OpenStack profile /etc/skel/.ostackrc CentOS, OEL: add python tools (nova, glance, neutron, …)

item.title: October 2016
item.description: Updated images provided on 2016-10-26. The major changes to the previous versions are: NEW images: Debian 8.6 and Fedora 24 Images include the latest updates from cw42/43 Network tuning according to findings Finalized net tuning for SLES11_SP4_SAPHANA Do NOT pin kernel on SLES11. Fix swap in firstboot. Ensure that cloud-init config is ran before sshd. openstackclient-1.5.0

item.title: September 2016
item.description: Updated images (_latest) provided on 2016-10-04. The major changes to the previous versions are: Images include the latest updates from 2016-09-30 Updated uvp-monitor Timezone no longer preconfigured for Europe but default UTC Set parameter back to default net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps=1 Updated images provided on 2016-09-08. The major changes to the previous versions are: Images include the latest updates from cw36 Timezone no longer preconfigured for Europe but default UTC. Pass timezone: Europe/Amsterdam in user meta-data to set CET/CEST timezone.

item.title: July 2016
item.description: Updated images provided on 2016-07-25. The major changes to the previous versions are: Images include the latest updates from cw29 cloud-init enablement: Set preserve_hostname: false on all images (as the hostname is now coming via metadata and no longer from Revert openSUSE42.1 cloud-init preinitialization CentOS-6.8 added (upgrade from 6.7).

item.title: May 2016
item.description: Updated images provided at 2016-05-30. The major changes to the previous versions are: Images include the latest fixes from cw21 Changed SSHD Config: AllowAgentForwarding=yes For CentOS and OracleLinux: disable requiretty in /etc/sudoers openSUSE42.1 cloud-init preinitialization to avoid double instance-identity resulting in overwritten ssh host key on second boot.

item.title: April 2016
item.description: Updated images provided at 2016-04-21. The major changes to the previous versions are: New uvp-monitor version included Images are build from including the latest fixes from 2016-04-20 Root PW injection now working for OracleLinux, SLES12 and openSUSE (workaround solution introduced) Changes to cloud-init: keep hostname of Nova (like listed in the dashboard)

item.title: March 2016
item.description: First images published with the launch at 2016-03-14 for the following distributions: openSUSE 42.1 (JeOS = Just Enough OS and Docker flavor) SLES11 SP4 SLES12 SP1 CentOS 6.7 CentOS 7.2 Oracle Linux 6.7 Oracle Linux 7.2

CentOS Images getImages("CentOS".split(",")); #imagebrowser .ib-content { max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; } #imagebrowser .ib-header, #imagebrowser .ib-folder, #imagebrowser .ib-file { display: flex; border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder:hover, #imagebrowser .ib-file:hover { display: flex; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder { cursor: pointer; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon { height: 0.8em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; transition: transform 100ms linear; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon.ib-open { transform: rotate(90deg); } #imagebrowser .

Oracle Linux Images getImages("OEL".split(",")); #imagebrowser .ib-content { max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; } #imagebrowser .ib-header, #imagebrowser .ib-folder, #imagebrowser .ib-file { display: flex; border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder:hover, #imagebrowser .ib-file:hover { display: flex; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder { cursor: pointer; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon { height: 0.8em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; transition: transform 100ms linear; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon.ib-open { transform: rotate(90deg); } #imagebrowser .

Red Hat Enterprise Linux Images Available RedHat Images We have dropped minor numbers for all distributions except SLES. This is because installing all maintenance updates for most distributions automatically implies moving to the next minor version – there is no possibility to stay on an old minor version and still have full maintenance, as there are no parallel maintenance streams per major version. (The only exception is SLES, where old service packs are maintained in an own stream in parallel to the latest for a limited amount of time.

SUSE Images getImages("openSUSE".split(",")); #imagebrowser .ib-content { max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; } #imagebrowser .ib-header, #imagebrowser .ib-folder, #imagebrowser .ib-file { display: flex; border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder:hover, #imagebrowser .ib-file:hover { display: flex; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder { cursor: pointer; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon { height: 0.8em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; transition: transform 100ms linear; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon.ib-open { transform: rotate(90deg); } #imagebrowser .

Windows Images Windows Server Image Content The Windows Server Images for OTC are build based on the Microsoft Standard ISO images It is a default OS installation with: System disk of min 40 GB Drivers for XEN, KVM, GPU (NVIDIA), BMS (Intel Chipset Drivers) RDP enabled latest Microsoft quality rollups and security patches timezone of OTC platform time synchronization with ntp server of OTC public service zone German and English keyboard Couldbase-Init agent installation and sysprep started During server startup server configuraiton is finished:

item.title: Flavors
item.description: Flavors Common Flavors Image / Flavor Normal,Compute, Memory optimized I Normal,Compute Memory optimized II, GP KVM Large Memory Disk intensive SAPHANA Large Memory s1,c1,c2,m1 c3 m2, s2, m3, d3 e1 d1 e2 e3 Hypervisor Xen KVM KVM Xen Xen Xen KVM Drivers xen=xen-classic or xen-pvops virtio virtio xen xen+ixgbevf xen+ixgbevf+xen-scsi virtio Flags __support_xen __support_kvm __support_kvm __support_largememory __support_diskintensive __support_xen_hana __support_largememory, ___support_kvm_hana openSUSE 42.

item.title: Kali Linux Images
item.description: Kali Linux Images getImages("Kali".split(",")); #imagebrowser .ib-content { max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; } #imagebrowser .ib-header, #imagebrowser .ib-folder, #imagebrowser .ib-file { display: flex; border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder:hover, #imagebrowser .ib-file:hover { display: flex; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder { cursor: pointer; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon { height: 0.8em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; transition: transform 100ms linear; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon.ib-open { transform: rotate(90deg); } #imagebrowser .

item.title: Ubuntu Images
item.description: Ubuntu Images getImages("Ubuntu".split(",")); #imagebrowser .ib-content { max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; } #imagebrowser .ib-header, #imagebrowser .ib-folder, #imagebrowser .ib-file { display: flex; border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder:hover, #imagebrowser .ib-file:hover { display: flex; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); } #imagebrowser .ib-folder { cursor: pointer; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon { height: 0.8em; margin-bottom: 0.2em; transition: transform 100ms linear; } #imagebrowser .ib-folder-icon.ib-open { transform: rotate(90deg); } #imagebrowser .
